posts.post_content:
You guys are all talking about how [Final Judgement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Final Judgement) can and can't exile [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus), but what you don't understand is that O-Kagachi (the creature in the art from [Final Judgement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Final Judgement)) *IS* [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus)!  
The flavor text from [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus) is *"The Soul of the World has returned,"* and some info on O-Kagachi taken from the MTG Salvation Wiki states that, *"It was the soul of the world, the very first kami, as old as the plane itself."*  
It also says at the end of O-Kagachi's story that he was eventually defeated, and so that would explain how he has returned - even if he returned in a different plane, in a different form.  
Is it not absolutely amazing that WOTC made this connection between planes, over (about) 5 years, and no one noticed?!?! [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus) is just [Final Judgement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Final Judgement) in creature form!!!  
  
If this was common knowledge, could s... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
You guys are all talking about how Final Judgement can and can't exile Progenitus, but what you don't understand is that O-Kagachi (the creature in the art from Final Judgement) IS Progenitus!
The flavor text from Progenitus is "The Soul of the World has returned," and some info on O-Kagachi taken from the MTG Salvation Wiki states that, "It was the soul of the world, the very first kami, as old as the plane itself."
It also says at the end of O-Kagachi's story that he was eventually defeated, and so that would explain how he has returned - even if he returned in a different plane, in a different form.
Is it not absolutely amazing that WOTC made this connection between planes, over (about) 5 years, and no one noticed?!?! Progenitus is just Final Judgement in creature form!!!

If this was common knowledge, could s... (see all)

posts.post_content: I play with progenitors all the time! He's an awesome card that's a 10/10 unfeakin unblockable that wreaked havoc everywhere! His one downfall, 2 of each mana to make you pay ten! The one great thing that you can do is summon him from your hand. Example: you play 3 on three, your friend plays a phyrexian obliderator. We'll \*\*\*k now he's not your friend anymore. People freak out, he world ends, so on and so forth. You then say ok we'll lure of prey! Play a 10/10 for freakin 4! That's the easy way to get him out. There obviously are other ways but that's the one way I get to Murder my friends! The only thing that I wish didn't get through was the evil, wretched , Nevinyrral's Disk!😋

posts.post_content:
100 years passed, and my brother and I discovered the new (hydra) avatar; an OMG WHAT THE F\*CK IS THAT named progenitus  
  
  
Also the head off to the side is the black head and the on in the very back is blue; those were the two colours cut off from naya so those heads kind of lost their power, but when the shards converged they woke up and now they slowly get their power back. I want an alt version of this card in his deceiver humanoid form.   
  
Also I feel mayael should've had her spark ignite after stabbing this mother hydra avatar
